title: Stop trying to force us to play with friends.
body:
Not all of us have friends who play league. You shouldn't be given an advantage in league based entirely on who you know.

The hextech chest system should not give people with more friends a fucking advantage, you should not get more boxes and keys just because of who you queued with. And you should not have an advantage in ranked simply because of who you know.

>
> If i dont know them ,why should i add them?

^ This a hundred fucking times. Why in the freaking world should I add strangers to my friends list in the first place?

I don't play LoL because I need new friends. I have friends, I have a wife and I have a son.

I play to relax and have fun. I play SOLO and I don't want to have a premade on my side nor do I want to face a 
Premade.

I will not spend another cent on this game until soloQ is back.

I'm married as well. I don't play league to make "friends", I play to relax after work and enjoy myself. I've added randoms in the past and tried to play with them; 9/10 times they end up toxic and I just delete them, so I just play solo unless my husband feels like playing a game of league. 

Not only that, but not everyone is social. My husband dislikes interacting with people, he just plays the game and enjoys himself. Why should he feel forced to interact with others and add people?

Yeah, I'm in the same boat. My friends don't like league, my girlfriend doesn't play computer games. I have zero desire to "make friends" with randoms in league. I just want to play on my own to have fun after work. Riot needs to stop trying to shove "group play" down our throats. Specially since, to keep it real, the people who fund this game are the older players with jobs who will actually throw money at it often as I have.

Older players may have more overall income to spend, but the  schoolkids probably still generate more profits. They don't need to pay rent or buy gas, it may not be good practice but they can spend literally 100% of their allowance and Christmas money on this game without any real repercussions. They are also less likely to understand the inherent disdvantages of digital goods therefore tend to be a much easier sell.

It doesn't matter which group makes Riot more money... they shouldn't give perks to part of their playerbase and not the other.  Grouping is already an inherent advantage due to increased coordination.  The new queue and rewards for grouping are literally enforcing that it is the correct way to play.  No company should throw part of it's playerbase under the bus.  What's more, there was no real reason to do so.  Riot just... decided 4 man premades should be the rule and have a massive advantage in games as WELL as getting more free stuff.  

I'd love to hear why they decided to go that way.  I'm certain they didn't intend to flip a large portion of their customers and players the bird... but they did.  And knowing Riot they are now going to be too stubborn to admit it and take that decision back.

Riot wants to make the game experience positive for everyone, their #1 priority now that they have become the most popular game in the world, is to eliminate toxicity in their giant player base. Riot's research has found that premade play correlates to a massive drop in aggressive language and behavioral reports (the pool party event was a giant test). Therefore they are pushing for premades to eliminate toxic behavior.

That is why they went this route. They have good intentions, they're not trying to screw solo players rather they are just focusing on what they see as the big picture. I just wish they would take a look at this from a solo player's perspective. Might not be easy for them everyone they work with is a League fan and I doubt you can pass their personality test if you are antisocial or introverted.

False correlation.  Premades see less toxic behavior because they're usually all friends, or at the LEAST because they're likely on skype or something and so they're not using the chat at all.  They could be cursing and flaming each other all game, but the chat would be pristine.

Premades however, still abuse their non-grouped teammates.  What's more, FORCING players to play in groups isn't the answer.  It's a stupid thing that is ruining the game for anyone who prefers to play solo or who doesn't have a pile of friends who play the game too.  Sure the 19 year old bro has like 10 other guys he knows who play, but the 26 year old guy with a job and a family doesn't.  

Imagine WoW during it's heyday releasing a patch that gave parties and raids +20% damage and health per person in their group... then balanced the monster stats around the inflated stats that they knew people would have due to this bonus.  The people grinding the game solo for fun are utterly RUINED now, because they are at a severe disadvantage against everything they encounter because they cannot or have chosen not to play with others.  

That's such a stupid idea that you KNOW it would never happen.  So why is Riot introducing things that give MORE advantage to certain players?  Having a group in skype or whatnot with you is already a big advantage over an uncoordinated solo team.  By allowing those groups into ranked they are basically saying "If you don't have a premade in ranked, you deserve to be playing at a disadvantage.  Even if BOTH teams have one, the solo players on each team are still left at the kids table to pick over the scraps while the people playing the game "correctly" decide who wins or loses.  

Riot massively dropped the ball here, and well-intentioned or not they should have seen the downsides of their actions before they made them mandatory.  Solo players shouldn't have to suffer for months on end just because they wanted to try something out and they're too short-sighted to have predicted the outcome.

So True !!! thanks you for your comment that made me happy i am not that kind of a social man myself and yet after being playing league since 2009 this is the first year that they force us to try to be more social and its hurt me.
Yeah same as what cppl said why add random people? There are some creepy motherfuckers lurking I definitely wouldn't suggest it to a minor

Got tired once of getting stomped by premades, so I finally asked one for an invite. First game the leader blamed and flamed me nonstop for not shutting down (as a 3/0 Quinn ADC) the 7-kill Morgana that their Zed buddy lost to. Last time I ever add someone post-game.

I understand completely how you feel, Jelly. Premades always team up with their friends regardless if they're wrong or right. Premade bias is ridiculously annoying and the worst part is that it isn't just in League, people do it so often in reality as well, if not more than online.

I had a group of guys add me to a game and I got called an asshole and snob because I said not to chase kills, to play safe, and focus on objectives like turrets. Because I know how to play the fucking game. I'm not the best player by any means, but I have an understanding of how League is supposed to be played in regards to the typical cardboard 7 mindset everyone has.
I don't LIKE to play with groups, I don't want to play with groups. I'm fine with playing with friends I actually know on rare occasion, but most of the time I just want to play by myself.

Forcing people to play in groups kinda defeats the point of ranked play. My rank should be affected by my skill and my skill only, not by "enemy has more premades and thus more coordination than me". And as we've seen, nothing stops players from queuing with friends on a much higher level and climbing - which is nothing less than a legal form of boosting.

If I want to mess around with friends, there's normals. Ranked should be there only for solo players or full teams - otherwise it becomes pointless.

I tried that couple of times, so far all of them turned into flaming assholes after I lost a game with them.

1 moment in a winning game they're like ''yeah gj team you are all doing great''

and then the next moment in a losing game ''OGM YOU FUCKING NOOBS GO FUCKING UNINSTAL PLZ SURRENDER GG''

So if you don't get something, nobody else should? Wow. It's an incentive for them, not a punishment for you.

As for gameplay advantages, MMR is adjusted to compensate, and the system tries to match groups with premades of equal size. Don't blame premades on your losses; they will happen whether if everyone is solo or not.

The question is why the incentive is there at all? 

Why are Riot so dedicated to enticing people to play in groups rather than solo?

Basically it's about money.

Because if you play with friends you have a greater time and you won't get toxic players, AFKers or feeders. Basically, with all the incentives they want you to find other players you enjoy playing with and multi-queue. It's a way to combat toxicity, get happier players and of course get them to spend more. Someone who's happily playing with his friends is more likely to buy a skin than someone who just gets angry at feeders.
